column4: Does anyone know how to bring the internet back up from the commandline?  The start/restart commands don't seem to work for me.
wifi
sudo service networking stop; sudo service networking start; sudo dhclient3 eth0    is one example
See...like I type status networking and it tells me: networking stop/waiting.  It tells me this when internet is up and running, and when it isn't.
mine says stop/waiting too, on this system I am typing to you on
And when I hit start networking when internet isn't running, all it tells me, again, is networking stop/waiting.
So I've been having to reboot to get internet working again.
try rmmodding the interface driver, then reload it back in then restart networking
if you run:  sudo lshw -C network    and read, you will see the driver name, you can then run:  sudo modprobe -r module; sudo modprobe module
Okay.  So that restarts the networking driver?
it will make the device stop workin, then wake up again. obviously change module for the actual module name
Okay.  Thanks.
